alert.note: Alert for Habersham; Rabun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 28 at 8:49AM EST until November 28 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR A PORTION OF NORTHEAST GEORGIA... The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect until 6 PM EST this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Rabun and Habersham Counties in Georgia. * TIMING...Through 6 PM EST. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. Winds will gradually subside through the afternoon. * HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Due to low humidity and breezy winds, in addition to dry fuels and ongoing significant drought conditions, any fires that develop could spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is strongly discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, .or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
